Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, we were not sure what to expect, other than the hotel had a great location. The location is definitely the primary selling point; however, contrary to other reviews, we also found the services to be excellent and the entire staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had two teenagers with us so we rented two rooms since the suites were all booked. When we arrived at the hotel around 9:00 a.m., we were fully expecting to be told that the rooms would not be ready that early. However, they already had one room waiting for us and it wasn't long before the second room was also available. In addition to the location being desirable for sight-seeing, the fact that it is on a guarded street (the hotel is just a few feet from the American Embassy) makes it a wonderful hotel if you enjoy sleeping with the windows open. It is incredibly quiet for a hotel smack in the middle of tourist attractions in a large city. The first couple of days we slept in due to jet lag and the only noise that we heard was the cooing of pidgeons. And it didn't matter how late we slept in, if we left the "do not disturb" sign on, we were never bothered by the maids and the rooms were immediately cleaned once we left. Speaking of the maids, we accidentally left our safe open with all our money in plain sight one day when we went over to our kids' room. After realizing our mistake, we went back to our room and discovered that the room had already been serviced. The money was untouched and the maid even came back later to tell us that we had left the safe open. If I had to complain about anything, it would be the price of the restaurant. We ate there the first night and that was the also the last night. The food was okay, but seemed a little over-priced. However, breakfast was good (included in our package) and room-service was excellent. This was our first trip to Paris, so we can't compare this hotel to any others in the city, but I don't plan on staying anywhere else when we return. If for no other reason, I highly recommend this hotel for its location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay apart from random charges on our bill!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Diva-KD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a fabulous suite from the 12th to the 16th of November 2011. We arrived around check-in time and was told that the previous occupants had not yet vacated the room we were supposed to get, which had a street view as requested. So we went from lunch and came back, but it was the same situation, so they offered us a similar suite which was inside the atrium so there was no view. We didn't want to waste any more time, so we accepted this. However I am disappointed that they could not do anything about the room we were meant to have. It was a lovely room, despite having no view. We had a few drinks at the bar, which has a great atmosphere. The drinks are always amazing at Sofitel bars! We found the location of this hotel to be excellent, so handy for lots of lovely shops and cafes, and just a two minute walk from the Concorde metro station. However, the hotel is on the same street as the back of a palace, so it is patrolled by armed guards and cars are not allowed to go down the street unless they have clearance. So taxis had to drop us off at the end of the street. Not much distance at all, although it may seem so in freezing weather and high heels! The hotel is right opposite the trendy, underground Buddha Bar, which we wandered over to one evening for a drink - very nice. We had breakfast once at the hotel, which was fine but expensive when there are so many nice cafes nearby. We went to Bread & Roses a few times for breakfast, just up the street a bit. It was very nice, toast, croissants, coffee, all you need for breakfast. Unfortunately, as we were checking out, a bill was put in front of us with lots of random amounts. We ate breakfast at the hotel on one morning only, and that charge was there, but then there was also a smaller amount and a larger amount on the bill, that didn't add up to any other breakfasts, also not our bar charges. When queried, these charges were removed right away, but it makes me so angry that these mistakes can be made. Please make sure you check your bill as you are leaving. I don't like to assume that the hotel are adding extra charges here and there to make more money, but the amounts were just so random! We would definitely stay here again, it is a lovely hotel in an excellent location. Hopefully next time we will get a street view room and no random charges on our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Kkusumo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for everything. You can go shopping easily by walking distance. You can go to Louvre, Concorde, Tuilleries Garden, Arc de Triomphe by walking about 10-15 minutes. I love this hotel because of its location. Dont expect good services from this hotel. Concierge, breakfast services was bad. Room cleanliness was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DavisandCo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the suite in March 2012. Rooms on the smaller side. The suite has no doors between living room and the bedroom. Bathroom also small. Nespresso machine in the room. Location is great, right next to Buda bar and it is useful to mention that you are a guest at this hotel, as then no reservation is needed for dinner at Buda bar. The reception was friendly, there is also printing machine and other office supply material. Would recommend for short stay, but not if you have children, suite is hardly large enough for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable, service very good”
Reviews.Author: LGuo
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, the service is excellent. From the receiptionist at the front desk to the customs relation officer (a very nice Thai lady) I found all the staff very helpful, eager to please and polite. The location of the hotel is excellent, it's less than 2 minutes away from the famed Faubourg Saint Honore stretch of shops. One word of caution though: we had dinner at the restaurant Les Collections on our first night in as we were tired and did not want to venture out. However, the selection of items on the menu is extremely limited and the main course which I ordered which was fish was extremely undercooked and had to be sent back to the kitchen to cook further.When it came out, there was a slight improvement, but it still was not very good. The gym, while adequate with elliptical trainer and 2 treadmills, has no free weights. Overall, this hotel is extremely reasonably -priced for its excellent location right in the heart of Paris' prime shopping stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: marinero180
Reviews.Content: You definitly pay for the location. The hotel is in one of my favorite area. Rooms are small, but it's pretty usual in Paris. Good level of service. Also the street is closed to most cars because of the US Ambassy that is just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling07086
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but the rooms are a bit tired. We were on the 2nd floor on the street side and it was a bit noisy, even on weekends. If you are a light sleeper request the back of the building and high floor. Shopping to all couture shops, the location cannot be better, the drawback is there are not allot of restaurants and cafes close by. The staff is super nice and they escorted us to the room and showed us where everything was located. if you are new to the hotel, when you are in a taxi you must request to be dropped at the hotel because the street is closed off because the American Embassy is on the end of the block. Another good thing is the Hotel Crillion is across the street from the Embassy and all the taxi drivers know where the Crillion is located if they do not know where the Sofitel is.

Reviews.Title: “Central and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Correspondent10
Reviews.Content: Very central. Perfect place if you want to see the city centre and do not want to spend time and money on transport. Staff professional, friendly and unintrusive. Five star room service good. Room size sufficient (normal room) but not big and a bit dark. Furniture, bathroom, cleaning etc all good. Very quiet side street - slept very well. Price was very good for a five star due to special offer (three days for price of two). Lobby ok, bar disappointing. If you are looking for a central five star where to sleep only (which is what we did) I would recommend this. Not if you stay in a lot and expect more (restaurant, bar, pool/spa etc).

Reviews.Title: “Adequate business stay”
Reviews.Author: mronion
Reviews.Content: Clean and convenient stay...rooms a little small but hotel,well located in a great part of Paris.....long wait at check in

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: stanislava_janet
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Paris, October, 2011. We stayed at the Hotel Sofitel Le Faubourg. For Paris will not comment, except to say that my expectations for this city were higher. About the hotel - no doubt the place is perfect! Everything else was pretty bad. We paid a Deluxe room - got a room in the attic, which was awfully small. During breakfast always had our seats and cabin accommodation in the bar. Me and my husband travel a lot and stayed always in five star hotels - but this definitely does not meet the five star. I think Paris is a city much overpraised and terribly dirty! Of course, except for historical sites and fine restaurants ......

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Somit12 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May 2011 for a weekend. The location is great, the hotel staff helpful and the rooms very clean. Our room was a bit small, but for that location in Paris, it is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel le Fauboug. Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Eddie H
Reviews.Content: While the location is great, the suite was dirty and the service was terrible. Worn out carpets, worn sofa to the point that the threads were almost showing etc. We stayed there for a week and other than making the bed and changing towels the room was simply not clean. Dust everywhere. The staff would even leave used teacups where we had left them. The bathroom sink was cracked and both the sink and shower drains were 80% blocked. In addition and at time of booking we were told that the room would be ready early. Upon arrival after a long flight, we were left to wait for four hours and did not get the suite until 3.00pm and that after 3 requests. The cost for our stay was $4200.00 aprox.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dieterdelarue
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel experience: - Best possible location (especially for shopping) - Spacious and luxurious room - Extremely friendly reception desk (room upgrade) - Extremely friendly concierge (great Itialian restaurant recommendation) Area for improvement: - Breakfast (good but not cheap; waiters slow and not very friendly)

Reviews.Title: “Five out of five!”
Reviews.Author: strawberry_501
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, it's expensive but it's worth it. A beautiful modern lobby, rustic French rooms with Hermes toiletries, and a perfect location in between the Champes De Elyeses and Opera. The corridors were a bit of a mismatch though engorged in dark pop mod art... it wasn't offensive but it was odd. Great breakfast with lots of fresh variety. Room service was amazing too - I arrived late at around 11pm but they managed to satisfy my hunger. Customer service is also highly commendable - courteous and eager to assist. Opposite the Buddah Bar if that's your thing. Or lots of great but expensive restaurants nearby. If you want something more economical, walk further. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Well done to the team.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet street, but not my first choice in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: amytravels2009
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel because we wanted to have the choice of a babysitter while we were in Paris. Although the staff were very kind and pleasant, we had a few little issues during our stay and although they were minor, I expected more from this type of hotel (and the price). Even though check in is at 2, our room wasn't ready and we had to wait in the lobby for almost an hour. It was a little annoying as we had been up since early morning and were traveling with a tired baby. Once our room was ready, we expected our luggage to be brought up (they had stored it for us when we arrived at 9 am) but it never arrived. My husband called but after waiting 45 minutes for it to come, he finally went down himself and brought it up. Also, for two nights our coffee wasn't restocked by the housekeeping and my husband again had to go down to the lobby and inquire about it. We also were given a free drink & chocolate for their bar with no explanation about time requirements etc. When we tried to redeem the offer, they refused because we didn't come between 3-6 pm. It was our last night and I find it silly that they couldn't honor two free hot chocolates. I've stayed at other hotels that were more reasonably priced and who pay more attention to the details. We also requested a club card, which we never received from the front desk, but decided it's best because we probably won't be staying in another Sofitel hotel. On a positive note, the location was great for our purpose as we walked everywhere with a baby and stroller. There is a grocery store a couple streets over, plenty of restaurants, and shopping galore all within minutes walking distance. Our babysitter through the hotel was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “What Could Be More Perfect?”
Reviews.Author: HLStride
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sofitel Le Faubourg from December 27, 2011 through January 3, 2012. We had never stayed at the property prior to our arrival and were not exactly certain what to expect from the hotel. From the moment we arrived however, it was clear to us that this was an exceptionally well run and well appointed hotel. The staff at check in was attentive and sensitive to our exhausted condition having just arrived from an overnight flight and I was thrilled to find that even at 8:30 in the morning, our rooms were ready to be moved into. The hotel is situated on Rus Boissy D'Anglais which is generally closed to through traffic and, as a result provides an extremely quiet location for its guests. It is close (on top of?) one of the great shopping areas in Paris and is also 1/2 block from the Place De la Concorde and the Champs Elysee. It was quite easy to get anywhere you wished to go. The rooms were well appointed. One of our rooms looked out into the lovely courtyard of the hotel the others faced the street. The rooms all featured large windows that made the rooms bright and the windows all opened to allow us to take advantage of the abnormally warm Parisian breezes. If I had a concern about the rooms at all it would be that the rooms with two twin beds were a bit small but, I suppose that is one of the constraints one finds in a hotel located in an older building. Small or not, we loved the rooms. The beds were incredibly comfortable as well. The hotel features a fantastic restaurant for breakfast and the bar, called Bar30 was warm and inviting. All things considered the Sofitel Le Faubourg is an excellent choice for anyone who wishes to find a hotel in Paris that is quiet, well located and exceptionnaly welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not that good !”
Reviews.Author: AlbertBelgium
Reviews.Content: I was recently staying at the Sofitel Le Faubourg and I was kind of disappointed by the hotel The price are high over 350 Euros for a room quite small and not refurbished The breakfast was not that great and the service in the breakfast room was that day non existing The location near the place de la Concorde is fabulous but I was expecting more for the price... The bar is good and pleasant Not sure I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: JabbaDurban
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully central, and if you want to walk Paris this really is an excellent hotel to stay as it is so centrally situated. The area is upmarket with beautiful boutique stores surrounding the hotel. the downside of the affluent area is that you will pay a significant premium for every item (clothes food and drink) that you purchase. The room was very nice - by Paris standards this was decent sized (although we did stay in a prestige suite) with the bed a pleasure to sleep in. The housekeeping was erratic and seemed to target to clean our room whenever we came back to the room (this should have been done whilst we were away for the day and not left until so late) - forcing us on occasion to go downstairs to the foyer. The breakfast was also not up to a standard for a 5 star hotel and this needs to be addressed by management. despite the downsides this is a good hotel and based on its fantastically central location wold consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely suite, not at Sofitel standard”
Reviews.Author: EP05313
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here after an issue with our room at the Sofitel Arc de Triumph. Upon arrival we were given a suite to compensate for the issues experienced at the other hotel. The suite was truly amazing from the bed to the bathroom to the overall space and design. We were met by guest relations and taken to the room. The lobby and reception staff were great. The breakfast was seriously lacking. Given that breakfast is between 32 and 42 Euros I would expect to be amazed. We arrived to be greeted as if we were interrupting the staff. We were shown to a table that was not clean and then left to sit for approx. 15 minutes. Having a look at the sparse breakfast selection we decided to opt for a la carte breakfast of coffee, an asparagus omelette, and porridge. The coffee came after 10 minutes and was cold. We waited about 20 minutes for our food and after asking twice finally received it. As they were out of asparagus I changed my order to a bacon omelette. We got the porridge which was more like corn flakes or soup and I got an omelette with a side of COLD bacon. As I asked the waiter about the breakfast he walked off. We then had to get another waiter who then got the manager. The manager apologized and said it was all because "it was a very busy morning." I explained to him that wasn't really my problem nor an excuse and we would not be paying or eating here again. If you decide to stay here go for a suite, although I assume they are a but pricey, and go out each morning for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location. Walking distance to all the shopping destination and tourist attractions. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and very helpful. Would definitely come back again especially with the rate we got. Its definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Greate location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HappyPanda7
Reviews.Content: The hotel located in the center of all shopping. Superior room is very small, you can't enter together into a bath. The hotel needs to be renovated. Better choose a room with a view to a yard, no view to the street, but quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Transit”
Reviews.Author: MRLepathy
Reviews.Content: Been there 3 times on transit, room is comfortable and clean but too small, would not consider for a long holiday. Cool bar for a late night drink. Feel safe to walk around the streets at night. The staff are very friendly specially concierge. Was very impressed with Maison Hermes right next door, the Boudha bar etc...

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel beautifully located but incredibly small rooms and even smaller bathrooms. No good ratio cost/quality. I paid 380 euro per day including the w.e.Super expensive breakfast (28 euro) in such a small room where you have to wait up to 10 minutes to be seated

Reviews.Title: “No hot water for a day”
Reviews.Author: Kallang
Reviews.Content: Pros (1) Modern room (2) Great central location (3) Lots of police around because of US embassy: you will not get mugged (4) Front desk can speak English well (5) Street outside hotel had limited traffic because of US embassy nearby. Therefore room facing street was fairly quiet. Cons (1) There was no hot water on the first day. Hotel staff were confused and did not know what was going on. Turns out the whole hotel had no hot water. Got letter of apology and some chocolates. Would have been better if there was a discount on the room. Unacceptable for a reputable hotel not to have hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is not the first time I stayed at this hotel. I really like it because it is soo central, close to everything and quite fancy. But this time, the service was horrible!!! I don't know what happen, but they seem not to care anymore. Just because they are fully booked all the time, it doesn't mean they should be sooo bad in serving the clients. Basically, at everything, they said NO. Do you have to change me a bill of 500 euros? No!! Can you call a restaurant for me, because I am not that fluent in French? NO. Can I have a late check-out because my flight is at 9 PM. NO. More, the room service forgot to bring me some choices I had and at the end the bill had extra minibar, breakfasts and a 'new' tax since I arrived at the hotel!!! Come' on, really? Then, because it was a prepaid reservation they insisted to charge my Amex again for the entire stay, just because the accountant (whoever) was on a lunch break and they couldn't check...Incredible! It took me one hour to check out! Impertinent, no politeness and a new thing they do: checking you out how you are dressed, what watch you have and so on. Bottom line: the worst service ever I faced in this hotel! Finally, I met one of the managers and I understood everything: the fish starts to smell from the head

Reviews.Title: “Cold service, in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: HarolddeMallet
Reviews.Content: One cannot deny the excellent location of the hotel although once inside the story is very different. The lobby is spacious and airy but the furnishings were stained and scratched. Check in took a little over half an hour since there was a queue and the staff were discourteous and unhelpful. We had a suite which was small and very plain. The suite was adequate although it was in need of redecoration, the furnishings being in a similar condition to the lobby. It was awfully small so I do not ever wish to imagine a standard room. There was a small dressing room which was paneled in inexpensive plastic wood substitute which was starting to peal off. There was another queue for breakfast and the maitre d'hotel was extremely rude and dismissive. Our breakfast was included although I was shocked to find that it costs 30 euros for the tiny cold buffet and if one were to want eggs one had to pay more. We had dinner at the hotel which was reasonable, in flavor, although the atmosphere was deadly. We normally stay at the Baltimore which is much better and has recently been redecorated. I would not recommend this hotel as the amount charged for the meager suite we had was absurd and for that one could stay in far better accommodation. It was still an average **** hotel but we have stayed in much better. The Memories I have of our stay do not make me nauseous, they just give me a sense of claustrophobia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: totorokl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. cannot be beaten on location Pros 10 minutes walk from the louvre. Luxurious hotel Quiet and safe; on the same road as american embassy Cons small rooms no tea making facility in room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shallots Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in a Junior Suite. The suite was luxurious and beautiful. Bed was comfortable and the shower was marvelous. The air conditioning worked and kept me cool. The TV at times lost its picture and/or sound which I fixed by turning off and on the TV which reset it. The breakfast was great although I wished they had salami cold cuts instead of just hams. European salamis are so tasty compared to American that I missed it. The staff was helpful and friendly, especially the lobby greeter from Thailand - she was always smiling and sunny. The bar was good. The bartender was attentive. But they served chocolate peices with drinks and that didn't go well with alcoholic drinks. The only downside to my stay was housekeeping not refilling the spare toilet paper holder in the bathroom so after I finished the 1st of 2 rolls, I was not given a 2nd roll again. Overall I will stay here again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmarty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful - truly five stars. Our week's stay was in a suite and absolutely wonderful. The location could not be better as it is close to the attractions and fine restaurants. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “sofitel le faboug-a warm welcome awaits you”
Reviews.Author: Eric K
Reviews.Content: extremely warm welcome,helpful concierge and walking distance to all the top brands which keep Paris as the fashion capital

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelicaw80
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Sofitel Paris Le Faubourg and would stay there everytime. The staff was exceptional! One of the managers showed us to our room and was more than sweet and kind. The room was beautiful, clean and spacious. Across the street is the famous Buddha Bar which is worth a visit at night for drinks! The concierge gave us the absolute best restaurant tips and things to do. Spring in Paris was exactly what I had hope and more because of this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very cosy around Christmas time”
Reviews.Author: FabienDavid
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very cosy around Christmas time I loved the tasteful design and decor of the lobby, and the complementary Hermes Orange Verte toiletries :-) Excellent location for window shopping in one of the most exclusive areas in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDuckDuck
Reviews.Content: This is amongst the best hotels Ive stayed at to combine everything in one package - service, quality, and location. The checkin process was effortless and the hotel recognized my Gold membership. My room was upgraded without being asked. The stylish lobby is ultra modern and chic. The hotel staff walked with me to my room to ensure everything was acceptable. The hotel is tastefully decorated and is incredible. The room is nicely sized and included large wardrobe / closets to hang all my clothes, suits, etc. The tv, bathroom, internet, essentially everything worked how you would expect. The hotel staff deserve an extra kudos. They are outstanding. Not only do they effortlessly switch to a variety of languages, but help with any question from directions, to where is the best place for ice cream. The prime reason for staying here is the location. There is no more middle of the city. Right between the Louvre and the Arc de Triumph, this hotel is the center Paris and is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Hans765 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: travelled to paris for a short one night stay early september. as a member of the accor program i looked for a member hotel near the main shopping areas. i decided to try the sofitel le faubourg. the location really is very convenient, all shopping areas, main sightseeing attractions are in walking distance we arrived early at already around ) a.m due to the flight connection. the room was not ready at this time but promised at around 11.30 which is already quite early as normally you get the rooms at around pm. in addition i was promised an upgrade due to my membership level. my original category was a junior suite. we came back at around noon for our room. the staff at check in were very courteous, helpful and as a customer you felt welcomed and expected. the guest relationship manager on duty showed us to our room. i immediately realized that this was a junior suite which i originally booked. i explained to the manager that i was promised an upgrade when we arrived in the morning. she said that she would check and we should wait in the room. after around 5 minutes she called back and apologized and explained what went wrong. she promised us an upgrade for our next stay and would try to make something work even for this stay: after a few hours of intensive shopping we came back to the hotel and the guest relationship manager informed us that the prestige suite now was ready and if we wanted to have a look. we sure did. after a quick look she asked us if we wanted to switch to the prestige suite. of course we agreed. the room was spacios, renovated around 2 years ago, technically up to date, lcd, free wired and wireless internet, nespresso coffee maker, free small minibar, seperate toilet, huge shower with a seat, hermes amneties. the queen sized bed was very comfortable. all in all the room was really nice and the wait was worth it. breakfast in the morning was good but not excellent. the variety could have been bigger. finally i have to compliment the concierge. all of his restaurant recommendations were really good and reflect the standard of this hotel. i am sure that i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything are ok, especially the services of the Concierge Staffs are very good. They are really experience and very helpful. The only thing a little bit strange of this hotel is the Breakfast Buffet, scramble eggs are provided but the hotel will charge an additional fee if you want other type of eggs (boiled, sunny side up, omelette etc).

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovechicago53
Reviews.Content: Good location, great service! We enjoyed Paris while staying at this lovely hotel. It's an older hotel but with plenty of character. The bathroom was nicely renovated and more spacious compared to many other Paris hotels. The front desk greeted us politely and were very friendly! We were not happy with the first room as it felt a little too small but the lady at the front desk immediately found two other rooms for us and actually took us to them to select the one we liked! A very quiet hotel with ultra comfortable beds! Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right Bank Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mike e
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arranged to stay at Sofitel to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary and we had a wonderful time staying at the hotel. Firstly you can’t beat the location with all Parisian landmarks easily accessible by foot or Metro. It is centrally located in a pretty upmarket area full of stylish shops, restaurants, cafes and boutiques. The Hotel itself has a great range of services and excellent buffet "petite dejeuners". The room though a bit small was well appointed, with full length windows that faced the court-yard. However, it is the staff who were the most important asset and in this respect we received superb treatment. They were welcoming, friendly and very professional. And whilst they are all a credit to the hotel, a special mention has to be made for Peggy and Charlotte. Merci Beaucoup and we shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely able to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Blissfulvacationer
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly, the buffet breakfast wonderful, the rooms clean, the beds probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and the pillows so fluffy I was tempted to buy one! An expensive hotel but for us well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: PCZT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for those wanting to spend some time enjoying the shops, and sights and food in Paris. The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and the service and welcome are excellent. There is a lovely cafe to have breakfast and the Buddha Bar is literally across from the front doors! You are within walking distance of the Champs Élysées and all the designer stores. There are lots of lovely restaurants within walking distance too. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, pricely tough..”
Reviews.Author: Carlo S
Reviews.Content: Hv been there as I needed a location near Faubourg/Place de la Concorde and Sofitel offered discounted rate while nearby high rating hotels were twice as expensive. Booked via their website. I have been lucky and got free upgrade at arrival (room just slightly large, Paris rooms are mostly small anyway). Check in was efficient and fast and room clean. Concierge service was efficient and friendly enough for the sightseeing suggestions. The bedding at Sofitel got the approuval of my very young girlfriend who has a passion for "featherbeds" and the like. As usual Accor makes me nervous about the price of breakfast (I usually avoid Accor hotels for this reason that makes me feeling robbed...breakfast should not be at a price over 10% room price!!) but I managed a reasonable solution via the room service. I am never on a budget but I hate wasting money... We also had dinner there. Being early January we were the only table, we enjoyed the dinner and we had a full courses meal and a reasonably good wine. Service was efficient and specially friendly in line with our usual mood and ...with an empty restaurant. The bill was slightly over the 100 euro each that is quite expensive even in Paris. I cant compain, just be advised if you decide to have lunch or dinner at their restaurant. They had a tuned piano in the lobby but no pianist along our stay we have been there. Overall, I would go there again whenever I can get a special offer as I had this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: brickej
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and loved this hotel. The staff were so welcoming and helpful. I had forgotten a travel adapter and the staff were so accommodating and found one for me within minutes! The staff speak several languages and we met one man at the front desk who could speak 6 or 7 different languages- a great help for people who don't speak any but their native one. Both meals we had in the hotel (dinner and breakfast) were great. The location is perfect; close to some of the major attractions yet on a small street away from the crowds. The room was flawless and the bed was comfortable. I will definitely stay here when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: excellent location, good vibe, great service, fantastic breakfast went for a run in the early hours of the morning, dropped my room key off at the reception - upon my return the key was attached to a bottle of water and was handed to me with a big smile stayed in one of the 'concept rooms' with all electronics controlled by a hand held gadget - great fun

Reviews.Title: “absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: rolf41
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located in the center of Paris. Staff was very, very friendly and helpful and the room was superb. Just great and I can really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but wonderful location and detail”
Reviews.Author: Katherine B
Reviews.Content: We stay here when the company pays and like it very much. Nice service and location and posh feel even though the rooms are small. Once we had a medical problem and the hotel was quick and fine about it. I do not recommend the food as it is way too expensive, but you can get good things in the neighborhood as you go down to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted with the service and the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Sofitel le Faubourg this August. We paid Approximately £360 per night to stay in one of the junior suites. On arriving we were shown to our room by a friendly receptionist. The room was lovely and spacious and met our expectations. Our first night we could not complain with the exception of room service which was a bit sluggish as it took around 30 minutes for the iron to be delivered. However on the second night after returning from site seeing we came back to our room to discover our money had been stolen. Money which was inside our rucksack inside the wardrobe. We proceeded to reception to make a complaint that our Euros had been stolen from our bag and also British pounds had been taken from the wallet. We were told we had to wait till the next morning to speak to the hotel manager which is unacceptable. They carried out a technical test on the room door showing that only two chamber maids had entered the room proving that the hotel staff were to blame. After this proof the hotel manager told us that she trusted her staff, a ridiculous statement as the receptionist from the previous night had told us it was not uncommon for money to go missing. The hotel told us it had nothing to do with them and we had to report the incident to the police station. Very disappointed in the treatment we received in the Paris hotel having had been to the Sofitel Dubai on Jumeirah beach which was an outstanding service. Having said that I will never return to Sofitel because of this experience and I think people going to stay here should be made aware that the staff are thieves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Kind Staff”
Reviews.Author: FarmerBen_61
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Paris many times, I have experienced many "filthy four-stars", hotel rooms with bathrooms so small you had to stand on the toilet to shut the door, and obscure locations far from the Metro or for that matter, civilization! I always wondered where the rich and famous stayed to shop at the elite little shops, and on this trip, I found it. The LaFoubourg was spotlessly clean. The location was an easy walk to the Madeline and Concord Metro stops. The neighborhood was elegant. My wife wished we could afford to buy at the little shops in the area, but window shopping was fun too! The hotel was immaculate and the room was small even by Paris standards, but well appointed. The hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly. We arrived looking tired and rumpled, but our children were welcomed and it was no big deal when we discovered that we had accidently booked single bed rooms. They switched us to two bed rooms and had our bags moved without question. The concierge helped us plan our days and book tickets online for the sights. The hostess opened the keyboard to the grand piano in the lobby and let my children play a short tune! The front desk staff was kind and helped us get a taxi that could get our party of six to the airport. I'm not sure how many stars this Sofitel has, but they deserve another!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly gem in a great location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiResident
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for almost a week in one of their prestige suites with my family (wife and 2 teenage kids). The location is perfect (opposite the Buddha bar; three buildings from Place de la Concorde); a short walk to both the Louvre and Champs Elysees. The hotel came in tops on almost every count. One of our kids was unwell for a couple of days and doctors were arranged by the Concierge quickly whenever needed. Food was excellent, but expensive, but that's Paris for you. However, the breakfast could have been better (they need to experience the breakfast at Park Hyatt Vendome). Room service is quick and the food is excellent, but the menu is too small. Housekeeping is efficient. The toileteries are Hermes and they are top grade (naturally, being Hermes). Although the suites are decently sized, the 'luxury' rooms will not be considered luxury in terms of size anywhere else but the true shocker is the size of the so- called 'superior' room. The one I was shown was so small, the only place to open your suitcase would be the bed. I was told that not all the superior rooms were that small and that the rooms were of varied sizes. Service: The staff is very friendly, cooperative and eager to please, which is quite an edge the hotel has over its competition. Overall, I have no doubt I will choose this hotel again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MalikaAD
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed in this hotel for four nights while we were in Paris. Since there were six of us, five adults and one child, we had two rooms. We were given complimentary cot in each room. One room was upgraded to a junior suite while the other was a classic room, bait small but expected in Paris. The location was within walking distance to the shopping district and major attractions. Christophe and Regis from the Concierge Desk were extremely helpful with our dinner reservations, tours, online boarding passes as well arranging transportation to the airport, which was no easy task considering we had seven large suitcases and three carry-ons! They even provided adaptors free of charge. Every day we were greeted by friendly staff with big smiles. Now that we are in Cannes, staying at the intercontinental Carlton, we appreciate Sofitel even more so! We are missing Sofitel! We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hermes amenities experience”
Reviews.Author: wveronica
Reviews.Content: I went to Sofitel Faubourg last week, it was such a great experience. Even though the room was small but they do have big bathroom and changing room. The room is comfortable especially the bed. The amenities were amazing by using the Hermes amenities experience in every room it was worth! Moreover, the staffs are helpful especially front desk, but the concierge time was not really convenient because they are not stand by 24 hours. The location is very nice, easy to get to luxury shops however, the security is every where because of US embassy. Yet, overall everything is good and fantastic

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel room facilities were terrible. The air conditions were NOT working at all. I requested to change the room, but it was NOT accepted. The hotel staffs demanded that to open the windows and to switch off all lights in room. They said that it is the best way to stay and sleep in the room. I did not believe that comments. I will NEVER stay this hotel and also never recommend to stay this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, and worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet little street that is super guarded because of the American Embassy located next door, so safety is top notch. The lobby is really nice, and their library is stocked full of fantastic art books. I never had a chance to try their restaurants, because when in Paris, you should be eating out. The room was fantastic, with great closet space and a huge marble bathroom. The bedding was super comfy, and I had no problem falling asleep, only waking up. All the toiletries were Hermes, and we were surprised to be greeted with a box of chocolates and complementary Evian water in our room. On our last day we had a 5 am wakeup call, and went down to get our taxi at 5:45, while we were waiting the bellman brought us coffee. Perfect last impression. Overall, the hotel was excellent and you should enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Paris Air Show. Decided to go late so had to scramble to get hotel. I have stayed at Sofitels in other cities but not this one. I highly recommend it. Great place to stay for shopping, sightseeing or business. Very quiet street next to US Embassy so lots of security. Can't say enough how the attentive staff and service. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LucasSantos
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here during my father birthday befor we take the train to loire valley. Great staff very helpfull and kind. The restaurant get a little confuse during breakfast, but with some pacience everything runs to a happy end. The room was good, facing the street that is very calm because of usa embassy that stays a few steps from the door. Crossing the street you have the budda bar, with great good, service and atmosphere. Recomend.

Reviews.Title: “You need more than location”
Reviews.Author: john23
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, you could not ask for a more upscale location. On the minus side, the room was small, I was awakened repeatedly by loud noises from the room above, and there was mold in the grout of the shower/tub. While the housekeeping was fine, the service in the bar was awful. Although service is included, the young waiter tried to pocket my change with a "merci beaucoup" as he turned his back on me and walked away. When I asked for my change, he pretended not to understand. I got the change and I'm writing the review because this never happened anywhere else I visited in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small luxury hotel in peerless location”
Reviews.Author: connell66
Reviews.Content: We visit Paris usually once a year for our Anniversary and for many years stayed at Le Faubourg. After a few years, when they contiually failed to acknowledge our loyalty to them, we took our custom elsewhere. However, with the wonders of Trip Advisor and feeling enough time had elapsed, we managed to negotiate a good rate for ourselves and decided to return to Boissy d'Anglas. The hotel is much the same as it was, except for the exhorbitant price of breakfast, which used to be included in the room rate. The corridors have been modernised (little improvement in my opinion) but we were given a lovely large room - amazingly enough larger than we have ever had in this hotel. We had a very nice stay, although needless to say did not avail ourselves of breakfast. The staff seemed helpful and friendly and the Concierge recommended a couple of excellent restaurants for dinner. He also got us tickets for the Manet exhibition at the Musee d'Orsay which were well worth paying an extra 3 euros for as we didn't have to queue! All in all, I would definitely return principally because of the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing location, amazing staff, amazing, amazing,..”
Reviews.Author: akumar25
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is so good, its centrally located, walking distance (10-15 min) to most destinations, great staff - very very helpful - I have never come across hotel staff so helpful. they go out of their way to make you comfortable and relaxed...Room is extremely comfortable (we were in luxury room) and did not feel it was too small. We were here for business+leisure and the experience was seamless!

Reviews.Title: “A remarkable and memorable first time staying in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: chainyza
Reviews.Content: One of the safest hotel in Paris. The hotel is next to the US Embassy, so you can find this place safe. The hotel environment are pretty friendly ! With lots of staff that can help you with everything in the hotel as well as the food ( especially breakfast ), they're terrifically fabulous !!! The room are quite nice,also their toiletries are from Hermes !!!!!, but a bit too small for suites room, also the cons are that the service are not perfect as I thought, one time I request an extra bed and it took me a couples of hour to wait . Moreover some housemaid aren't friendly ( but most are ), if you're a foreigner just ignore them and say " Merci Boku" The bed is quite nice, I slept in the extra bed and it also comfortable. Unfortunately, the fitness club are too small, yet still the equipment are in high class ( TechnoGym).

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing - but the best location”
Reviews.Author: FLIDK
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Paris for business together with my wife. At arrival at the hotel we were escorted to our room by a guest relation employee. Immediately when entering our room we were met by a bad smell of smoke. How a room in this condition can be released is out of my understanding? We were offered another room of course and waited in the room while the employee tried to find an repalcement. We waited.... This took a while and some confusions, However we were taking to another room. The smallest room you can imagine.... when asking if we could have a room similar to our "original room" we were given 2 options. We could take the small room or they could try to air clean the other.... ... at this point we were a little stressed (not what you expect when you check into a five star hotel) as we now were lvery late for our restaurant reservation. So we had no choice than to accept the room... i asked the luggage to be send up, as we were short on time. No Luggage for more than 10 minutes! It is not a problem for me to bring my luggage to the room..... but it is a problem when I assume that this is taken care of by the staff.. All in all a VERY dissapointing hotel experience. On top of this there were a few other hickups.. After waiting to be served by a waiter in the breakfast restaurant for 20 min my patience ran out and I left. The day before we were struggling to explain to the staff - also i nteh breakfast restaurant - that we would like to have our coats which were stored in hte back... their english were not existing. The bar connected to the hotel is very nice - (the mojitos awfull) and across teh street you find budda bar. I sound like a sad old man - I know - but this was not ok - sorry. I suppose that we had an exceptional bad experience, which is probably not normal for the sofitel Le Fabourg... however i do not know if they will have another chance to make up for it. I normally stay around the corner at the Hyatt..... and this is a whole other world I can assure you. So if you want to play safe, book at the Hyatt instead. The location of Sofitel is great (the road is closed for trafic due to the location of the American Embassy a few blocks away) - so this is the only thing which could drag me back for a second and absolutely last chance - but you probably find me at Hyatt next time...

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Paris @ Sofitel Le Faubourg”
Reviews.Author: JByrd52
Reviews.Content: Expectations were exceeded. From the moment we walked in it was outstanding! 5-Star Awards to - Hotel, Entire Staff, Restaurant, location, service. 1st time ever in Paris would not have been the best vacation we ever had if not for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was outstanding and memorable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gwillia1
Reviews.Content: We were ugraded to a lovely Prestige suite and provided a complimentary bottle of champagne! The entire staff are fantastic and help in any way. The concierges are all incredible and provided superb suggestions for dinner each evening. This property is a real gem in Paris and has an incredible location to Rue St. Honore and close to many other attractions such as The D'Orsay museum. A very special thsnks to Mary, the assistant manager who assisted us with our reservation and the upgrade for our special occasion. We felt like we had our own upscale apartment in Paris! Thanks to Mary to providing the upgrade to a Prestige suite for our celebration! The location is incredible and near Rue St.Honore shopping and is within walking distance to the D'Orsay museum. The staff and concierges are fantastic! T We have both been to Paris before,but never together, so our stay at the Sofitel Le Faubourg was magical and we both sincerely appreciate everything that was done for us!

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping hi-fashion shopping therapy”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_tangjitsatukij
Reviews.Content: if you are a hi-fashion shopping queen who also love Macaron !! here is a place u must stay. security is the first thing u find before u arrive at this hotel. lovely bellboy... ok and small gym with fantastic rain shower experience !!! all provided by Hermes.. but the room and toitel is a too small.....but ok enough for paris or a couple of people staying there. in room amenities are Evian water and Bose i-pod stand for your non-stop music.. Buddha bar is just opposite the hotel.. just 5 mins by taxi , u will reach Avenue Montaigne where u can do more shopping. Hermes flagship store, Lanvin, Chanel, BV YSL etc are just a minute away...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: BrantP
Reviews.Content: If, when you go to France, you expect rude people and poor service, then this is the best hotel in the country. For example, if you order room service for two, you'd better make sure that you explain that this means TWO sets of silverware, TWO cups, and food for two, etc. And don't expect an apology. "Sorry" is not in their vocabulary. Got a walk-in closet ? Good. Put a bed, TV, and nightstand inside. That wold be your room. But no worries. You won't spend much time in your room. The night club accross the street will keep you from going to bed early and the jackhammers at the construction site directly infront of the hotel will keep you from lounging in the morning. You'll look forward to getting away from the hotel to go sight seeing. My advice...STAY AWAY. We're still here and can't wait to leave !!

Reviews.Title: “Definatelly NOT value for money”
Reviews.Author: imakhnachev
Reviews.Content: > 9 out of 10 people don't speak English well enough, they pretend they do but when it comes to figuring out details it's just don't work. can't distinguish > a bed cover from a blanket after 3 attempts. Breakfast - in my view 35 > eur or so is a bit expensive given the lack of proper hot dishes apart > from suspicious scrambled eggs and strange looking sausages I.e porridge > or Fried eggs included would be nice ( paying extra takes your bill to >50- 60eurs easy; perhaps Sofitel should check what u get for these money > in other g7 countries in similar or even better hotels,leaving aside their > beloved notion of Paris being centre of the universe). A lot of bowls > and cups weren't clean. Ain't being paranoid but it's either clean or > not. Room service - pretty quick but when called straight after the > order to add an extra item the person on the other side of the line > was definatelly annoyed a bit as if they are paying me for ordering > food and not vv.! Also - on one occasion few fruits were ordered > including 1 apple - a quarter of it was completely rotten ( not > squashed or pressed but ROTTEN) I.e . A person not seeing that > (although it's not possible) or deliberately sending it to the room is > not a good person!) I regret that my iPhone was discharged and I > didn't take a photo and didnt make a big fuss out of it coz it was > late and baby was already sleeping. Also everyday I wanted to order a > simple meal for my kid. Boiled chicken with potato very finely blended > meaning no small pieces in the food. Gave up after 3 times and around > 80 eurs bill!! Pathetic for a 4star hotel in Paris!  Iam not saying it > is all bad definatelly there were good and very good things about > Sofitel. Concierge service very useful and efficient. Reception was > good too. But all in all 340 eur plus 50 eur for breakfast and the > above mentioned experience will not make Sofitel la fabourg my choice > in Paris again. Regards >

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location, on a quiet traffic free street off the place de la Concorde. The slightly larger rooms are much better sized than the standard room, which I found were on the small side. Great beds, nice bathroom and comfort good. Food etc is overpriced in the extreme, as is mini bar and Internet. All in all it's not bad - it's not special at all but it's a solid choice particularly if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This hotel was exceptional. We couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: Lostandfound1968
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this place. We were a little skeptical since we were looking for a boutique-like hotel and this was a French chain. We couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. We stayed for six nights and booked the package that included the museum pass, daily breakfast and a dinner-for-two. The breakfast was good, but got a little old after six days. The dinner was superb. In fact, it was one of the best meals we had in Paris and that's saying a lot. When we checked in we got a room upgrade. The suite was well appointed and fashionably decordated and included two flat-screen tvs and a huge bathroom. The room was the quietest I've ever stayed in. The hotel is located on a closed street next to the American Embassy and is in a perfect location.The service was superb. The staff went out of their way to help you. The only negative was the concierge desk. Most of the staff was well informed, but one of the guys knew less about Paris than we did. It was an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travel0h0lic
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Le Faubourg is a bit of "home away" for us - this is our address in Paris. We have stayed there several times and love it. On our own and with our daughter. The rooms are small by US standard but OK by Paris standards. We put comfort, calm, situation and security first and the Sofitel hits all points. We love the area, 1 minute walk from the Madeleine Church. All shops are close by. The only negative we've experience I can think of is that once the breakfast room was just too busy one morning. We were placed at a table hidden in a corner and service was a bit slow. Also the buffet wasn't refilled as quickly as needed. A good option is to take breakfast in one of the many bistros surrounding the hotel. Although keep in mind this is a pretty chic and expensive area so breakfast would be around €20 per head anywhere. We can't wait until our next visit in a couple of weeks from now.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bruno80799
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Le Faubourg is very well located near the Palais de l'Elysee and Place de la Concorde. The street is closed and you need a special authorization to park your car (you can also take the valet parking service). The hotel is very classical and conformable. Not too big. Tip: the Buddha bar is just opposite the hotel. Very good food and music.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoJo79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept 2010 . . Great location, near to subway, wonderful shops along the way, a lovely Hermes and other designer stores on the way to Madeline subway! I loved Buddha Bar opposite the hotel, a tiny bit pricey, but that is Paris in general. Size of the room was ok, but hardly spent any time there. didnt add breakfast, but there is a lovely cafe a few doors down. We had to wait at check in as our room wasnt ready, but we had complimentary drinks. staff were helpful and friendly. Great outdoor seating, restaurant looked nice, but I loved the stream room! after walking miles and miles, it was great to have a relaxing steam! I loved the fact that it was in a quiet location as the US Embassy is at the other end of the road across from the Obelisk. . . This hotel is expensive, Paris all over really, oh yeah, housekeeping were great! - Merci Good places to drink were in the Latin Quarter near Notre Dam, you HAVE to see the Eiffel Tower and do a boat trip along the Seine. I prefer the New York Sofitel as the staff and location were superb, but all in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CruiseGirl2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great staff that was very very helpful. The service was top notch. Most spoke English too. We arrived jet lagged at 7:00 am and were given a room immediatly even though check-in was not till the afternoon. The room was clean and the beds are very plush. In the rooms were hand made marshmellows, rasberries and currants waiting and bottled water. The bathroom was clean and modern with a nice deep tub and Hermes bath products. Location was great too. Within walking distance to almost everything. Great shopping is only steps away. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mje186338
Reviews.Content: This has a great location, close to the metro and within walking distance of a number of sights. The rooms are small, but that's Paris for you. Having said that, the room, the bathroom and separate dressing room was very comfortable and very attractive. The breakfast is one of the best I have ever experienced in Europe, make sure your booking includes breakfast, it's worth it. The staff are efficient and helpful. We had a couple of small problems in the room and someone was sent to fix them within 5 minutes. Because the US embassy is at one end of the road, the street itself is cut off. This makes it a very quiet location. As a four star hotel it's not cheap, but I felt I was getting my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius-Paganini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in the begining of July in the Jr Suite. This room is very good, with a nice King bed and a sofa bed for our 5 yrs old son. The room is very quiet, and the street is very calm also. It is close to 2 metro stations (Concorde and Madaleine) which take you almost to every metro line. In the this suite jr there is a free cable internet, but not free wireless. I really don't known the size of the standart room and its confort. But all the hotel seems very nice. The only thing I think it could be different is the price of the Breakfast - it is 30 EUR per person, despite it seems a very good breakfast, for me it is to high. But I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Best location in PARIS”
Reviews.Author: oceanbeat
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. The rooms are spacious for Paris standards, very comfortable beds, luxurious roomy marble bathroom with Hermes products. The staff is courteous and very helpful and attentive. (provided guest umbrellas at the front door while raining). The location is unbeatable : steps from famous rue Saint Honore close to all the high end shops and hip bars (Buddha bar across the street).steps to place de la concorde and the famous hotel crillon and walking distance to madeleine, champs elysees etc. Also as the American embassy in on the corner and the street is closed to traffic which makes it very quiet and secure. If you want to stay in Paris and make the most of it, this is you hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beasty62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for four nights in May, left to spend one night in Normandy and returned for our last two nights in Paris. It was a lovely hotel with a charming lobby, and we experienced top notch service. I communicated via email with Jerome the Concierge prior to arrival to book our dinner reservations. We had breakfast included in our stay and it was the best breakfast we have experienced in Europe. Wonderful assortment of fruits, breads, cheese and meats, as well as eggs. Our first four nights we had a deluxe room that was very comfortable and what I expect for a four star hotel in Europe. When we returned from Normandy we were upgraded to a luxury suite for our last two nights. The suite was gorgeous with all the luxury amenities, it certainly made our stay unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel with rude staff and technical problems - avoid”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Klaus
Reviews.Content: I planned romantic weekend with my wife but I this hotel did not meet even closely the expectations, specially with 395Eur/night price. Various problems. First of all, room we were given was a very very small one, no street view, although I reserved a package with room upgrade, according the hotel reservation status. Hotel was fully booked, so no room upgrade and very small room. (so part of the package was kind of zero-value) Air-condition was off when we arrived at room and it took long to have pleasant level of temperature. With the price I payed I dont expect this to happen. Air-condition should be always on! Second problem, the shower was extremely hot, as a result of broken thermostatic at shower tap. Well, the tap was repaired in one hour, but as naturally I needed to wait for the repair, I almost missed my meeting at the evening. When I reported this problem at check-out, the staff was "very sorry" - but the attitude was horrible. Last problem, before my arrival I reserved tickets to Louvre. When we arrived, they couldn't find those reserved tickets. Receptionist said "please check from Concierge for tickets". Yes I did after, but I would expected that receptionist does that for me. Concierge had some free tickets, which was nice so problem did not enlarge. With the 395eur for night, poor experience and horrible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/Quiet/Decent/5-stars High Class Hotel w/Bargain Price if book online”
Reviews.Author: c0wkim0n
Reviews.Content: This is our Honeymoon Day 5 at Paris, we are so amazed with the quality of the hotel we choose and book online thru our agent, it was a 5-stars hotel that we didn't really expected after reading some comments here, we have a doubt, but one of the comment keyword mention "CLEAN" trigger us to give it a try, and it truns out so nice that I have to signup this tripadvisor account just to let ppl know :> Im from canada, been travel a few places around the world, never really pick any good hotel cause I want to save money, but for this trip, it is our honeymoon, and I know how a clean freak my wife is, so I decided to find something better, after some discussion with our travel agent, and some research online, we realize most of the hotel cost in Paris is around $120-150 euro for a live-able environment, but I know this is not enough, so I check $150+ but below 200, and not much selection there, sofitel spark our eyes, but comments on this hotel weren't too good... but we went for it anyway :> Result: Hotel - locate in a high end area our room - nice and quiet, clean looks - everything looks good, it is a hotel mostly for business ppl, so be sure to dress up, even if you just go down to lobby to ask for water Anything you ask for: extra cost, but is reasonable

Reviews.Title: “we like to go back”
Reviews.Author: pugetto
Reviews.Content: This is the second time at this hotel as my wife and I (in our late thirties) find it extremely pleasant and a very good fit for our concept of vacation in Paris where we have been a few times now. As we like to wander across the city, location is essential for us and we are keen on spending a little more money in exchange for the comfort. The hotel is not too large, providing a cosy atmosphere. The quality of the service and food provided is in general very good; in this respect we have experienced room service, dinner and general services of reception and we have always been treated with high professionalism, courtesy and even with special attention as my wife got a little gift for her birthday during our stay, which we found an exquisite sign of care. During our 2 stays we have been respectively in luxury and junior suite rooms, finding them a perfect fit for our purposes. Rooms are always clean and well served. Even though we do not spend too much time in the room, we definitely enjoy the high quality of the bed which provides a very good quality of sleep. Advices: possibly ask for a room that has windows not on the street as the other ones get quieter. Only shortcomings I can recall: if you are a late riser, you will find out breakfast is served only until 10 AM (as a result we always opted to go out). Internet connection is not free for those who care... but there is wi-fi access in your room

Reviews.Title: “On my way into Africa.”
Reviews.Author: ChuckH3
Reviews.Content: After the trans-ContinentaI flight I went to enjoy my evening meal , which was certainly an Epicurean delight.. But upon returning to the room, I was ready 4 a fight. Some SOB had gained access 2 my locked room while I was away. Now that's not something that happens 2 me everyday. I reported the missing Sturm Ruger belt buckle to the front desk. Needless 2 say, I didn't sleep a wink that night.

Reviews.Title: “We eagerly look forward to our return”
Reviews.Author: bigmo166
Reviews.Content: Outstanding and caring Guest relations. Everyone very accommodating

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: dhtate
Reviews.Content: Located off Faubourg St Honere in a quiet and private side street just by Concorde - 5 star location, service and amenities. Breakfast was delicious with several fresh squeezed juices, from carrot, to red fruits as well as your basic OJ and apple. Lovely beds and we had a lovely, quiet 2 story suite with good space. Definitely one to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel hits the right note”
Reviews.Author: bw27
Reviews.Content: Superbly located hotel and very charming with it. That it is close to many of the foreign embassies means that it is a no through route for cars (taxis are allowed to come down and collect/pick up) and this means that it is wonderfully quiet. Staff were charming, discreet and helpful. Bar, though small, is attractive ( and clearly attracts a lot of Brits). Breakfast extremely good. All in all, a great place to stay in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: BonitaS2
Reviews.Content: The accommodations and location were superb! Easy access to Champs Elysees, Eiffel Tower and all other main attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service”
Reviews.Author: vicbutterfly
Reviews.Content: Sadly, only stayed one night at this beautiful small luxury hotel. It was elegantly decorated but with a relaxed, welcoming feel and the staff were very helpful and courteous at reception and consierge. Our room was lovely, obviously newly decorated with the most comfortable bed, would love to have brought it home. The bathroom was spacious with clean lines and tasteful fittings the Hermes bath gel and soap etc were a very luxurious and delightful addition. I would definitely stay here again as it is great for the beautiful shops of Faubourg St Honore, ideally placed for the Champs Elysees or Musee de Louvre and is also right opposite the Buddha Bar.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DemisCyprus
Reviews.Content: Value for money. Superb service and location. Very close to all the big attractions of Paris. All the good shops were very near to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright”
Reviews.Author: Cookiewatermelon
Reviews.Content: Room small. Bathroom Hermes amenities. Bed very comfortable. No view outside.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: On the plane between NYC, London, Paris, St. Barths, Dubai, and Hong Kong
Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: o73o2
Reviews.Content: there is a reason the french do hotels well - and this is the place where it really shows. great hotel. location is excellent. the room is great. the service is best i have experienced in a while. i found some of the small cafes around the hotel to offer substantially more value than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY ACCOMMIDATING AND CENTRAL TO EVERYTHING.”
Reviews.Author: Nicky70NewYork
Reviews.Content: Went to the Sofitel Le Faubourg in Paris for part of our honeymoon. The staff was excellent, probably the most accommodating people I had met in Paris. The rooms were very clean quiet and very comfortable. Especially the bed, I haven't slept that good in a long time. The hotel itself is in a very central location. It is near everything you want to see in Paris but out of the hustle and bustle. There were a few nice bars, cafes and restaurant very near by. This all made our honeymoon a whole lot more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent beds, pillows, wonderful ambiance and location.”
Reviews.Author: guataparo
Reviews.Content: Is a very nice hotel, good location, good transportation very close, wonderful breakfast.And the most amazing bed and pillows... very quite room. The concierge team is veru friendly and helfull. The locationis excelent. We will repeat this Hotel and recomend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly memorable visit!”
Reviews.Author: PeterNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: The Hotel surpassed our expectations; from the arrival greeting (baggage, check in, concierge, etc. until we checked out, the staff were among the friendliest and most professional we have come across, (including, Ritz, Four Seasons, Jw Marriott, Westin..). Room overlooking the inner courtyard was excellent, (if a little on the small side). The hotel ambience and location is second to none. Concierge's recommendation for a bistro type restrauarnt neraby was outstanding...Royal Madeleine.

Reviews.Title: “Thank god for the location...”
Reviews.Author: BochanTraveller
Reviews.Content: Because it truly is spectacular - smack bang in the centre of the 1er, a block from Place de La Concorde and across from Le Crillon, probably Paris' best located hotel - and certainly one of its most expensive. So, you're patting yourself on the back for your discovery, and forgive the room its better days as you settle in. OK, so maybe it's seen much better days. Like days when you could make out the original pattern of the carpet. Or even maybe swing a cat. The sheets are nice, the beds comfy, the showers work, but it's all ok cos again, you tell yourself, this isn't a big deal - after all, you're paying €300, when across the road they're paying three times that. So you head downstairs and make a booking with the concierge for dinner making sure and sure again that he understands you don't want anything traditionally 'touristy'. So he nods and winks and smiles and shrugs and calls and then bundles you into a cab to a restaurant with the word "Parisienne" in the name and although you have your suspicions, you give him the benefit of the doubt, only noticing on your exit (as your stomach threatens to empty) that the locals are shooting you looks of the deepest, most intense pity. So you complain to the concierge and he apologises and assures you it won't happen again. But why doesn't Sir and Madam go for a drink at the bar? A drink which (when it arrives after half an hour), you're sharing with a doormouse. When you complain about aforementioned doormouse, the waiter shrugs his shoulders (in that unique Parisian way) and announces that of course he is here - the bar is too pleasant and warm for him not to be! So, exhausted, you head off to bed. Oh yes, that very nice bed. And then you wake up (to a cleaning lady entering your room unannounced) and decide on a bite for breakfast. Wow (you think), how many staff there appear to be here! So you sit, and you order a coffee and wait. And wait. And wait. And wait. For thirty minutes until a cold cafetierre finally arrives. But you also ordered a four minute egg and that takes an extra ten minutes (total: forty), having been boiled for all of four seconds. So you send back your raw egg to one of the dozens of headless staff (who turns out to be the general manager) and wait. To get another egg. Cooked for another four seconds. When you show the damning evidence to the general manager, she shrugs (again, in that Parisian way) and says it's not her fault if her cook can't cook. So, hungry and a little angry (but still happy that you only paid €300), you go back to the concierge and get the address of the small, undiscovered, local restaurant that he's booked you for lunch. I don't think I need to continue...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jobelgium
Reviews.Content: I did congratulate the director, mr. Frédérick Thiébaut, in person for the excellence of his hotel and staff. This is a perfect illustration how a hotel should function.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the room really good. Was in a "prestige" suite. Beware not to have the "duplex" ones, you loose a lot of space. Been there twice in 3 weeks, left some stuff in between. When I went back, one thing was broken : no excuse, no compensation. I had to send a mail to complain to the boss, all I had was a upgrade for next visit.... Breakfast too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Again”
Reviews.Author: FatBoySteve
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel Le Faubourg several times the latest in October this year. The hotel has a great location for both business and leisure. The Hotel is well manged and well looked after, the staff will make sure that they do all that they can to assist. I would like to pay special thanks to Melissa the Guest Relations Manager, the latest was a business trip in which I took some important guests, Melissa made sure that all was in order before our stay and during. As mentioed, good location and breakfast is to die for (just make sure you get it as part of the package -or it will cost you a package). Food at other times is expensive but of a good quality.

Reviews.Title: “OK (being Paris) but not at these prices”
Reviews.Author: Westonian
Reviews.Content: I booked four nights in a "Prestige Suite 45sqm 485 sqft with 1 kingbed and 1 separate living room" and on the website there was a photo of the (very elegant) purported living room. The rate was 590 euros ($850) for the first 2 nights and 680 euros ($985) for the second two. So you can imagine what I was expecting, and you can equally imagine my reaction when I arrived exhausted from Beijing and was shown to what I can only describe as a garret on the top floor. The door off the corridor opened into a literally closet-size room containing a desk and one tiny armchair -- no more because there was no room for another piece of furniture. This was the "separate living room." A steep, uncarpeted stairway led to a small, low-ceilinged bedroom in the attic which contained another miniature armchair in addition to a double bed. That was it: my Prestige Suite with 1 separate living room for an average rate of $920 per night. I called Reception to register the obvious complaint, and was told by the distinctly unapologetic receptionist that there were no other suites available. I insisted, referring to the description and the photo on the website. I was told that someone from Guest Relations would call. I stood by the phone waiting for ten minutes. Then someone from Guest Relations did call and told me (without explanation) that I was being moved to another room. The new room turned out to be a suite as per the website. So the message here is that should you choose to stay at this hotel, be prepared to be shown a room which bears no resemblance to what you are paying for, and hope that your complaint will be as successful as mine was.
