Because we are talking serious money here. Leaving aside that problem, is it still worth the money? Not if you're expecting the five-star attention to detail which is consistent with the price. The housekeeping stands out as being of particularly poor quality. Used to finding your toiletries in the bathroom neatly arranged on a linen cloth? Not here. The two small bottles of water supplied each day were not provided on one day, even though the paper coasters for them were left in place on the bedside table. The vase of flowers was removed on Day 3 and never reappeared. The opened, empty boxes in which laundry had been returned were not removed for two days running until I pointedly placed them on top of one of the wastebaskets. The laundry pick-up on one day did not occur until I called a second time, nearly two hours later. Speaking of laundry, one shirt costs $19 and there is no option to have it on a hangar (in other words, it comes back in a box, pre-creased). Oh, and once you have used the laundry list that was in the closet when you checked in, it will never be replaced so you have to call and ask for another one every time you use the service. This hotel's main advantage is its location on the same street as the US embassy, since this means the street is closed except to abutters and therefore there's no traffic noise. Aside from that, it's pretty much your typical hotel in Paris, with scary elevators, malfunctioning Internet, weird phone, and that $12 can of Diet Coke in the no-we-don't-trust-you electronic minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay in a very central location.”
Reviews.Author: stewartmackie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three night break for our anniversary in September 2009. The hotel was lovely and the room was great albeit it was very expensive to stay here. We were overlooking the front of the building. The staff were very helpful and they had left us chocolates in our room on our arrival for our anniversary which I thought was a lovely touch. The hotel is very close to the metro at concorde and so easy to get around. We stayed here because it was central but to be honest with the metro being so efficient it wouldn't matter where you stayed for getting around all the sightseeing spots. We did not dine in for breakfast at 28 euros each or even dinner for that matter as it was so expensive! A pleasurable stay in a very quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kpmcookies
Reviews.Content: This room was amazing! We had a beautiful room that looked onto a small garden with windows that opened all the way inwards, just what I would think of a Paris hotel room. They use Hermes bath products, which smell amzing and now I have to go buy because I miss that smell! there is one note on the HOTEL BAR: do not go! It is a pretty bar, but it cost me $49 for two small vodka and orange juice. I thought that was insane, even for Paris. Other than that, I would 100% stay there again! Such a pretty hotel and I will never forget that wonderful smell!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is pure perfection”
Reviews.Author: fairfax15
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Le Faubourg is a fantastic hotel ideally located just off the Place De La Concorde and the Champs Elysees.Walk to the Louvre through the Jardin des Tuileries or along The Seine to the Eiffel Tower.The Metro (Concorde) will get you easily to Notre Dame (Line 1 Hotel de Ville) or to Montmartre ( Line 12 Abbesses) The hotel is located on a quiet street which is mostly closed to traffic (next to US Consulate)For our 1st ever stay in Paris the hotel and its staff complemented this fabulous city and made it a truely memorable 20th anniversary visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjalaeikhoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Sofitel Le Faubourg Aug 28-Sept 6,2009. We had a great stay. Our room was very comfortable- service was great. Everyone spoke English and were very helpful. Beautiful lobby and library. The hotel dining room offered great food and room service was reasonable "for paris". The location could not be better....walking distance from Eiffel Tower (about 35 minutes), Louvre (30 min) and Champs Elysees (15 minutes)......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 day break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sirflashpoint
Reviews.Content: Extremely well located, close to Place de la Concorde. Very quiet as access to the road restricted by police as the hotel is actually connected to the US Embassy(Chancery). Very well apointed and a very smart place to stay. Hotel room quite small but well appointed and in really good condition. Air conditioning only just adequate but quiet. Did not eat breakfast as 32-42 Euros a person is steep. Restaurant closed due to holidays (the staff not mine) but had a delicious meal in the courtyard bar. One down side, although a small problem, is the electronic key(for elevator and room) that was only programmed a day at a time until I complained a bit more. Helpful staff - a nice place to stay Local restaurants can be difficult to find (except the oriental one across the street. However walking towards Opera solves the problem with lots of choice although this is probably the most expensive part of Paris going by the number of exclusive clothes shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, overpriced & poor breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: Maxiiie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a superior room. The room was very small and was very aged. Their was just enough space for a extra small bed. The breakfast was very poor and every day the same : Ham, cheese, bread and fruit this you expect in a two star hotel but not in a four star hotel! The fitness is also very poor : their are only two machines !The location is very good ( Concorde ) It is a very safe street because a few meters away is the American embassy ! The staff is helpful end friendly ! Sometimes a little bit nuisance from The restaurant at the other side of the road .

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: arakashi
Reviews.Content: I can not believe that this hotel is only number 260. It is absolutely beautiful and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. They upgraded us to a suite (free internet in the suites), and had champagne and flowers in the room waiting for us, very sweet... The room which was so pretty, very French, with big casement windows. The bed was divine (sheets, duvet, pillows), it made it hard to get out of the room! Very pretty bathroom. Location was great for sightseeing. They even had a gym. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and position”
Reviews.Author: SpaldingHoff
Reviews.Content: we have just stayed here for a long weekend, perfect postion away from the hustle of paris but just steps away from the shops and sights,there was one thing that i should say is that the bar drinks are a bit pricey but most things are in Paris so its best to not look and have a lovely time and enjoy it.we did we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!!!”
Reviews.Author: sharistar7
Reviews.Content: The hotel made our 15th wedding anniversary trip a truly amazing experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kate20091
Reviews.Content: We had read a lot of reviews on Tripadvisor before booking the hotel room, so we were prepared that the room would be small. We booked the hotel room about 2 months in advance, so we got the early-booking-rate for a luxury room with queen bed. The room was definitely small, but it worked. It wasn't quite the standard you would expect when paying so much but it was ok. All the staff were very friendly, efficient and helpful. We got the concierge to prebook taxis for us several times. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, much due to the price of 32 euro pr person. That was no problem, for there are several boulangeries, coffeshops and pattiseries nearby. We had breakfast at Ladure in Rue Royal/place de la Madeleine, Delices de Manon in Rue st. Honore among other places. One evening we were so tired we didn't want to go out for dinner so we ordered room service at the hotel instead. We ordered Caesar salad, french onion soup and club sandwich. The food was really good for being room service, and there were a lot of food. We felt very safe at the hotel. The street is guarded by two policemen at each end due to the American embassy being there. The policemen have to open the street especially for cars to drive in. In the hotel elevator you have to present your key card to make the elevator go up. There also is a safe in the hotel room for which you set your own 4 digit code. The maid comes twice a day. In the morning, and in the afternoon to make the bed ready for the night. They change towels both times if you want to. We got 2 bottles of Evian water every day. There are Hermes amenities in the bathroom. They were too perfumed for my taste. If you wanted wifi you had to pay extra. We wanted to get online on wifi from both ipod touch and blackberry, so we payed 9 euro for 24 hours. The location is absolutely perfect. The street is parallel to Rue Royal and it crosses Rue st. Honore. The hotel is just a few meters from Place de Concorde. You have metro stations near by both at Place de concorde and at Place de madeleine. If you mostly want to stay in the more "fancy" parts of Paris you hardly ever have to use the metro at all, only for your own convenience if you don't want to walk so much. We walked to Place de Opera (were the Garnier opera is), we walked to Printemps and Galeries Lafayette, we walked to Louvre and the Orangerie. You can also walk to Musee D'Orsay. We took the metro to The arc de thriumph and walked down Champs Elysee to Place de Concord. If you are a gourmet, place de Madeleine is a great place. You have Laduree, Fouchon, plenty of caviar bars and deli's. You should also visit the gourmet-department at Galeries Lafayette. Rue royal, Rue st. Honore and Rue du Faubourg st. honore is shopping heaven. You find almost every fancy designer boutique there is. Cartier, Hermes, Bottega Veneta, Gucci amongst others are just a few meters away from the hotel. One evening we had dinner at the hotel at the end of the street, Hotel de Crillon. This is a 5 star traditional luxury hotel. We ate in their no. 2 restaurant l'obelisque. Traditional french cuisine that was superb (even without michelin stars). We haven't seen the rooms at Hotel de Crillon, but our conclusion is that if you can afford it - then choose the Crillon. If you can't afford that but want a ok, safe and friendly hotel with small rooms and perfect location, then choose the Sofitel Faubourg.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel, but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: MLWScotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is vexpensive but high class and very well located and the bedrooms very comfortable and quiet. But it has flaws. We found the price of breakfast extremely high, 32 euros per person! You could spend less on dinner! So we had to take breakfast outside. We also found it unacceptable to be asked to pay for internet use in the downstairs lounge/business centre. I wanted to check in for my flight but ithey wanted to cahrge me to do that. Then,for some reason we had to ask each day, two or three times, for water. The minibar system is ridiculous. My wife picked up a can of coke and put it back. It was on my bill, and removed when I noticed. Although I followed the instructions for a wake up call, and these were confirmed, no wake up call was received. So great hotel, great location but some irritations which should not be there at this price

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Would love to return”
Reviews.Author: iadggm
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Paris to celebrate my 25th Wedding Anniversary. The staff at the Sofitel Le Faubourg helped to make the trip wonderful. I have no complaints about the facilities. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was included in our tour package. Breakfast had a wide variety of foods - likely to appeal to diverse travelers. Unlike some previous reviews, I found the restaurant staff to be just fine -- smiling and attentive. Without a doubt; however, the strength of this hotel is with the Concierge staff. Travel guides offer some assistance, but often have dated information. We dealt with all three members of the Concierge staff. All were gracious and happy to assist us with booking dinner reservations, tours and with general information as well. I would describe myself as an assertive person with discriminating tastes and I have left bad reviews of hotels when warranted. The Sofitel Le Faubourg is a very good hotel and I would recommend it highly for either business or leisure travel

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: hbsquaredUk
Reviews.Content: Upside: location, location, location! Nice small balcony with enough room for a chair that looked towards Place de Concorde. Hermes toiletries. The most comfortable bed ever (even a booklet on how to order if you wanted to buy one). Very clean. Downside: room not 5 star standard with missing knob on bedside table, cracked basin, telephone cabinet had damaged foot, carpet worn and frayed in one area, breakfast ridiculously expensive at 32 Euros and minibar /roomservice also very expensive. Not enough space to leave case out as room really not that big. Service a bit off hand after initial greeting when I first arrived. Seemed to improve a bit when I spoke again in French. Phone made bleeping noises during night at 4.30am (had to put receiver in minibar to stop it) and not fixed when reported. Expensive (but maybe the exchange rate on the Euro an influence): I paid an average including taxes of 267 Euros per night for a Luxury Queen for 4 nights which took into account 1 'free' night. (this was not expressed as a free night but used to reduce down the cost per night for all 4 nights to the 267 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Total perfection!”
Reviews.Author: GHH_Girls
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Paris for four days last week; it was her first visit there. I was really looking forward to the hotel, having read such positive reviews but the reality far outweighed my expectations. We could not fault any aspect of our stay and will look no further than Le Faubourg for any future visits to Paris. I would recommend it without hesitation to anyone. After a particularly traumatic journey from Gare du Nord, it was bliss to step through the doors of the hotel with its beautiful interior and be welcomed by a wonderful gentleman (Davy) on reception who was so helpful and showed us to our lovely room, explaining everything in perfect English. All the staff we encountered during our stay were charm personified - the doormen, all reception staff, the bellboys, room service - and we felt thoroughly cosseted. The bed was incredibly comfortable and because of there being no traffic, we had very peaceful nights. The hotel's location is superb and the patrolling Gendarmerie at either end of the street add an extra element of security. We used Angelinas - a 5 minute walk -on Rue de Rivoli for fantastic breakfasts and also Laduree on Rue Royale, which was also fabulous. Aux Delices on Rue St.Honore was a total rip off, coupled with a thoroughly uninviting environment. We are already thinking about returning at Easter to indulge once again in the luxury and thoroughly wonderful surroundings offered by Le Faubourg. My daughter was most impressed and loved the hotel. Her first experience of the most beautiful city in the world was undoubtedly enhanced by being able to stay at this superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, French ambience”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFast
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location, near Place de Concorde, the Seine, and Louvre in an upscale area of Paris. Ten minutes walk from Blvd. St. Germaine, which leads to all of the small cafes in the Latin Quarter. As the previous advisor wrote, it's near the American Embassy & Hotel Crillon, so the street is blocked off from traffic. It's across from Paris' famous Buddha Bar, a hip place for dinner or to listen to loungy international music (tres chic). For breakfast, definitely go to Lauduree, an old-fashioned pastry shop, complete with painted ceilings, gilded mirrors, and delicious French pastries. Go there for breakfast, lunch, or tea and admire this special piece of Paris (2 blocks from hotel). Hotel is 2 blocks from Concorde Metro stop, or you can catch a taxi at Hotel Crillon 1/2 block down (one of the ritziest hotels in Paris). Excellent location for walking around Paris or taking the Metro. You can also take the Roissy airport bus to the Opera Garnier (<15 Euros?) and then cab it the 5 blocks from there (<10 Euros). Rooms seem to vary quite a bit within the same room class--some are teeny with huge bathrooms or vice versa. They're decorated tastefully and have floor to ceiling windows. It reflects the French decor that you would hope for when vacationing in Paris. Staff was great and very accommodating. My only complaint is that the maids continually slammed the linen room doors starting at 7am 2 days on a row, which made it impossible to sleep (and it was a weekend). I hope the Sofitel can do something to retrofit their doors to minimize the disruptions for future guests. Overall this is an excellent hotel, but try to get a discount (I would not pay 800 Euros per night to stay here...)

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Paris Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Traveller73London
Reviews.Content: All I can say is a huge thank you to Sofitel Le Faubourg who made our trip to Paris absolutely delightful. On our previous trip to Paris we spent four nights at the Millennium Hotel in a tiny room – with a disproportionately high ceiling, joined endless queues for museums and endured bad restaurant food everywhere we went. Our trip to the Sofitel Le Faubourg could not have been more different! We had booked three nights on a three for the price of two offer which made the rather high Parisian rates more affordable. We arrived late evening and after a warm welcome, were upgraded – I have a platinum A|Club card – and went up to our room to discover we had been upgraded to a suite comprising a large bedroom, separate living room and one and a half bathrooms with walk in closet. Undoubtedly the best hotel upgrade I have ever had. Both rooms were extremely comfortable and pleasantly appointed in a Parisian style with individual climate control. The suites are at least double the 30sqm advertised area of the Deluxe Room we had booked. The hotel’s location is perfect, as described by other contributors, on a police guarded, closed street just off Place de La Concorde and we had no problem arranging taxis through the concierge and the doorman. The Louvre, Tuilleries, Musee D’Orsay are all an easy walk as are L’Opera, Printemps and Galleries Lafayette and there are numerous top end fashion stores nearby if you are feel like splashing cash or simply window shopping as well as wine and gourmet stores. Few things in Paris can be considered cheap although sometimes paying a little bit more seems to get you better service than the sometimes surly approach tourists come to expect from bistros and bars. I am extremely pleased that we paid a little extra and chose the Sofitel which turned out to be well worth it. The standard of accommodation and service was excellent. All of the staff we dealt with at the front desk, housekeeping, in the bar and restaurant worked hard, were friendly and courteous and efficient. The only minor negative was that breakfast was extremely busy. On our first morning we had to wait for a table though not for long, and again tables were quickly cleared and people were seated as soon as possible. There was an army of waitstaff at breakfast and it was quite a ballet to get to the buffet without colliding with a waiter. However, that said, whilst the staff whirled round the room everything seemed to get done and requests for more coffee, juice were all met with a courteous and efficient response and a smile. On the second day we were seated in the bar which is decorated more for evening (my partner said it was like having breakfast in a bordello) but was quieter than the breakfast room. The buffet selection (as other contributors have noted) was smaller than one might expect - but there was sufficient and it was replenished. One other point to note was that the bathroom shelf was slightly wobbly and the hand held shower hose leaked - there was also a fixed head shower so we mostly used that. This might have been more of an issue if we had paid full rack rate for the room. Generally I felt that the impressive hotel staff ran a very tight ship. On top of this the location is superb and the comfort just right and I loved every second of our stay. I would definitely chose the hotel for my next trip to Paris although I do feel we were particularly well looked after on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Sad Decline”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 7 years ago and had fond memories of the property. Sadly, the present reality doesn't measure up. Nothing has been done to upgrade the hotel during that time and they are resting on their magnificent location - the absolute centre of Paris. Like others, I found the breakfast left a lot to be desired. There are too few places if more than a fraction of the hotel guests turn up at normal breakfast time. The staff are surly, I think, partly because of this. The buffet was lean considering the price charged. It was carefully contructed to look as if there was more than there was, but eggs weren't replenished, the juices weren't fresh and there was a tiny quantity of pastries and bread. Another member rightly fingered the coffee as undrinkable. To expand further, it is bitter, stewed and lukewarm. The rooms are small for the money and the photos on the web site use a fish-eye lens to make them look larger - an alcove actually looks like a corridor and so on. This hotel is masterful at nickel and diming. An hour's use of the Internet costs 20 euros - outrageous. On no account order room service - a teabag costs 7 euros, half a bowl of soup 14 euros and when I ordered the caesar salad it turned out to me a small slice of warmed over chicken breast on 10 ( I counted) strips, not leaves, of lettuce for 17 euros. The staff are perfunctory - except for the porters who are genuinely pleasant. This is a four star hotel no matter what claims it makes to being a luxury property. When it says that rooms measure 20 square metres - the bathroom is included. On the bright side - the sheets are crisp and impeccable, there are Hermes toiletries in the bathroom and, of course, the location is superb. What I feel has happened since my first visit is that the cost-cutters have been at work and it shows. There are far better hotels to stay in for a memorable and enjoyable visit to Paris than this one for the price. Also, it must be noted there are a large amount of business travellers in groups if you are looking for a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “second time isn't always better than fisrt one”
Reviews.Author: matteo64
Reviews.Content: This time I have to say our stay at the hotel was not like the first time, even though i must say that is one of my favourite places in Paris, always above the average among the same category of hotels. I thought that the second time in the hotel should bring some benefit, just as the good will of the receptionist to check on the pc what room number one client had the first time and maybe give him the same place, already well known. I wrote them to ask for it, an amazing e-mail, and then i called them, using my terrible french (perhaps this is why I didn't get what I asked for..and someone could say that my english is terrible too)..nothing doing: we had a very little room at the first floor and when I asked the receptionist why she told me that the category was the same, luxury room, and none told her that we had another room last year, more, she couldn't find what room number we had so..take or leave..room taken (nice but in 20 square meteres you can't do any movement if you're not a perfect couple dancers) ..the concierge was a perfect help for me and my wife, I called him from Italy to book two restaurant, he called me back after few minutes to confirm he managed everything for us, I asked him to check if our fly was confirmed and he answered me in real time..these are the little things that make the difference..just as the breakfast, huge and with a very multiple choices..the cleaness of the room and the products in the bathroom by Hermes..but do you want to know one thing? When we were going to leave the hotel another receptionist, during the check out told us:"Why noone gave you the same room you had last time? It was number...."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gunshy24
Reviews.Content: The Exemplary: 1- Location- This hotel is in the middle of everything. For those who enjoy walking, the Musee Du Louvre, Jardin Des Tuileries, Place De Concorde, Notre Dame, Musee D’Orsay, the Champs Elysees and our favorite breakfast pastry shop Aux Delices De Manonare (400 rue Saint-Honore, try the most delicious Palmiers in Paris) are all within walking distance of the hotel (within 10 minutes by foot). 2- Hotel- This is a boutique style hotel. Not very large but not ultra small either. Don’t expect to see large groups of people hanging in the lobby. The lobby is elegant, with plants, fresh flowers and a small library. The staff was also very nice, spoke excellent English and was very helpful. We were even greeted by the hotel manager which was somewhat of a surprise. The rooms were well appointed but small. Not closet size, not too small, but small nevertheless. The all marble bath was beautiful, with a heated fog-free mirror, Grohe faucets, and a daily supply of Hermes bath and beauty products. Our room had a small balcony with opening French doors (of course) that overlooked Rue Boissy d’Anglas - which gave the room a larger feel. The room was nicely decorated and had a 32” LCD TV (although the English language programming content wasn’t very great). Another nicety was the fact that the hotel was on a closed street with police at both ends. This made it very secure and quiet. We can only imagine that those staying in other hotels whose rooms faced a busy street heard a great deal of loud traffic noise. The Unforeseen: 1- Laundry service prices. Typically when traveling we like to send out all of our slacks, dress shirts and jackets to be pressed. Upon arrival we pulled the laundry order sheet from the closet to fill it out and were surprised at the prices. Since the hotel does not supply an iron you’re either stuck with the exorbitant laundry costs or you just have to wear you clothes with some wrinkles. Our advice: buy a travel iron if you want your clothes to look neat. 2- Taxi service from hotel. Taxis can be hard to come by in Paris . Since the hotel is adjacent to the American embassy the street is closed to vehicular traffic except for those vehicles permitted to enter by the police. So when we needed a taxi to take us to dinner we asked at the front desk earlier in the day. We gave them a specific time and had them call us when the taxi arrived. If you do this make sure that you’re at the front door when the taxi pulls up. It seems that the meter starts running when the taxi is hailed by the bellman at the end of the street. The several minutes it took to receive the phone call, grab our things, wait for the elevator and proceed to the cab cost almost 10 euro’s. That’s about $16 dollars before the cab left the curb! TIP: just walk to the end of the street to the taxi stand at the Hotel de Crillion where the cabs are always waiting (there’s also a metro stop there as well). 3- Internet prices. Having carried a laptop across Europe to download photos at the end of each day we always had the desire to connect to the Internet to check e-mail, weather, reservations, etc. We found the cost however to be somewhat excessive. (9 euro’s/2 hours or 16 euro’s/day). I will admit that we’re somewhat spoiled by the free Wi-Fi that we have all over the United States . Conclusion- The Le Faubourg was everything that we expected from a Parisian hotel in this price range (corporate rate of 311 Euro’s/night for a deluxe room). It was slightly American in its appointments but still possessed a great deal of French charm. The location is excellent, the staff perfect and the rooms very nice. We would stay there again and recommend this to anyone who’s looking for a centrally located, quiet boutique style hotel in Paris . We want to say one other thing about Paris . Having arrived there with all of our preconceived notions of Parisians who did not care for Americans we must go on the record as saying that everyone we met was nice to us. When dared to eat in restaurants with French only menus they offered to help us. When a sudden thunderstorm hit, our cab driver (who did not speak a word of English) tried to find us an umbrella to keep our evening attire from getting soaked and ruining our dinner in the Eiffel Tower . The simple thing to remember is that a little French goes a long way, even if you only learn how to say “S’il vous plait, parlez-vous anglais?” , excuse me, do you speak English!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, expensive, sloppy room change”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: I am writing from my room here right now. Earlier today when we returned, we were asked to move from Room 203 to a similar room (but no terrace) on the 1st floor. OK enough but they were very pushy calling 4 times in the 7 minutes we took to pack, standing outside the room for us to leave, etc. Claim was a water problem. Once in the new room, they sent champagne (I do not drink so that is a waste of money and not appreciated) and the maid to make the bed over (were sheets dirty?) who did not knock and did not seem to care that she caught me in my underwear. Oh well. Comfortable bed, good location, clean, very expensive breakfast, kind enough staff. Not sure this was the best choice and the first time I ever stayed in a Sofitel in France (thinking it would be the natural first choice).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large room, low ambience”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: This is a great, functional, business hotel next door to the largest Hermes in Paris, across from the Crillion and the Budha Bar. In essence, probably the most central location in Paris. The hotel was very nice, clean, HUGE bathroom with a full luxurious bathtub for soaking; all great. Not huge on French ambience, however we loved the piano bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Location, style, service it has all three!”
Reviews.Author: Izzyk
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with my mother in law and my husband and her were meeting me in Charles de Gaulle as I was flying from a different airport. My husband and her successfully checked into the hotel but when he arrived at our room there was a pervading smell of glue. When he complained to reception he immediately had our room changed without problem (the hotel were laying a new carpet) which was the source of the smell. Our room was nice small by American standards but large by European. It was very classic without being oppressive. We looked out onto the internal courtyard. It had all you would expect safe, satellite TV, mini bar etc. The shower was fabulous and very powerful and we had bathrobes and slippers provided. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in; I usually don’t sleep well when away but had no such problems here. Unfortunately my flight from Southampton was considerably delayed so I had to abandon plans to meet with everyone at the hotel and instead met at the restaurant we had pre-booked. We went to Au Bon Accuiel (check out the forums) which was fabulous but unfortunately returning to the hotel I forgot I had left my case in the taxi which drove away. The receptionist was amazing she contacted the restaurant to get the details of the firm which they had called for us contacted the company and within 10 mins the taxi driver arrived back with my case refusing all offers of cash for returning. The location of the hotel is brilliant it is right next to the American Embassy so the street is closed to traffic other than that cleared by the police at either end. It is opposite the Crillion which has a taxi rank and is also the stop for one of the hop on hop off bus companies. It is only 2 mins walk to the Place de la Concorde and a similar walk in the opposite direction takes you to the likes of Chanel, Dior and Hermes. Breakfast is a buffet affair the waiting staff are superb and remember where you sat and what you ordered each day. You can also order omelettes etc at no additional expense. The only drawback I would mention is the cost to drink in the bar. However if you do drink there try the cocktails the measures are huge so good value for money. There is a nice little bar down the street which closes at 6pm though. We did not see any other little bars locally to while away the time. Overall I really rated this hotel for location, quality of the room and fabulous service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Shepley
Reviews.Content: Hving spent 3 nights here between Xmas and New Year this is a really good hotel - about 4.5 out of 5 on the Trip Advisor scale. It is not cheap and you are paying for one thing above all else - the location. It is on a narrow street between the Rue Faubourg St Honore and the Place de la Concorde - there can be very few better sites for a hotel. The presence of the American Embassy at the end of the street means that access is guarded. One ot two taxi drivers had a distinct preference to drop us off at the end of the street rather than go through the security checkpoint (dodgy papers perhaps) but we're concerned with about 50 yards here and unless it's lashing down with rain that's no big deal. The upside is that there is no way anyone is going to get mugged near this hotel!! As another reviwer remarked, the security arrangements mean that there are not really any passing taxis. But we simply asked the concierge to arrange one in advance when we went out each evening and on every occasion the taxi was there early - no complaints at all. This is prime Parisian real estate and the one thing you are not going to get here is acres of space in your room. You are paying for location not square feet (or metres). But the room was well equipped as was the bathroom and the bed was extremely comfortable. No real issues with noise but in the summer if you had windows open the Buddha Bar opposite might be a problem if you are sensitive to this sort of thing. As ever the usual value for money argument exists over breakfast. The Cafe des Ambassades down the street is a lot better value - try the freshly squeezed orange juice. It's not open on Sundays though. Staff were excellent. The only 2 small drawbacks were a malfunctioning TV (soon fixed) and no non-perfumed soap available (my wife is allergic to perfume and had run out of her own supply of non-perfumed. The regular soap provided was very strong). These are minor points though and should not deter anyone from staying at a smart, well appointed and traditionally chic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Sofitel Le Faubourg”
Reviews.Author: rosegirl1958
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Faubourg for 7 days 10/27-11/03/07. The hotel was great. The location was unbelievable, just as the previous reviewer stated. It is within walking distance of all the major sights. The Hotel was immaculate both in the public areas as well as our room. We stayed in a Jr. Suite facing the courtyard room #320. The room was very quiet and the size of an American hotel room. The bathroom was huge with a big tub and separate large shower. They change the linens daily and do turndown at night. Be prepared for the amount of smokers in Paris. Our room was completely smoke free, however, the beautiful bar area was always full of smokers. This was true of every bar in Paris. We were told that Paris will be completely smoke free in all public areas in Jan. 2008. Everyone in the Hotel spoke English and was very helpful. They gave us directions everywhere and made several restaurant reservations for us. All of the restaurants were very good and reasonably priced, for Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again. I found the lowest prices on the Hotel website. Do not add breakfast in with your reservation, as it was very expensive and just o.k. There are many cafes etc. that are much better and much cheaper. Make sure to go to Laduree for breakfast or dessert. It is one block from the hotel on Rue Royale, Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ufpack
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. We arrived to the hotel around 10:00 am and a room was made available by 11:00 am even though check-in was not until later that afternoon. All staff spoke very competent English and some spoke Spanish. All staff were very professional. Our trip was for pleasure so I cannot speak for the hotel's business amenities, although it did seem to be populated by many more business guests than tourists. The only reason I can think of why there are fewer tourists is that the hotel does not show up on many guidebooks of Paris; however, the hotel is ideally situated for the tourist. Consider, the hotel is: 1) 1 block from Concorde Metro station which has 3 lines (looking at the Metro map, I could not find a station that was better situated with respect to lines accessing major tourist sites), 2) surrounded by the highest-end stores, e.g. Hermes. 3) practically across the street from one of the top luxury hotels--The Crillon. 4) a 5-minute walk to the Champs Elysees. 5) a 5-minute walk to the Tuileries gardens. 6) 15 minutes from hotel entrance to Louvre entrance via line 1 of Metro. 7) 20 minutes via metro to Marais (again from hotel and metro line 1) 8) 15 minutes to Arc de Triomphe. 9) Less than 30 minutes to Notre Dame (and in the other direction) Eiffel Tower. These spots would be closer if they themselves were closer to a metro station but each requires about a 10 to 15 minute walk from the nearest metro stop, Cite for Notre Dame and Ecole Militaire for Eiffel Tower. 10) Montparnasse is even accessible within 15 minutes via line 12. I will add that the hotel was spotless--both public areas and our room. The bathroom was very nice--marble, stainless steel, anti-fog mirror, etc. The bed was extremely comfortable. Yes, the room was smaller than our bedroom at home in the US, but it was large enough to hold all 2 suitcases, 1 bookbag, and a laptop computer without us triping all over our stuff--makes me realize how much extra room we probably don't need in our own bedroom. If you want to spend most of your time on the Left Bank, then this hotel will not be for you. For me, given its ideal location and the fact that we only had 4 days to visit the sites of Paris, it was worth the money to stay at the Sofitel Le Faubourg.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: simhampton
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a lovely location for shopping. But the "gym" is rubbish - two running machines (broken), 1 step and 1 cycle (both old) and 1 exercise machine.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but noisy and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Oxford_grrl
Reviews.Content: We booked a Junior suite here for late August 2007. As already reviewed, the location is great - between Hotel de Crillon, the American Embassy and Prada! - and very convenient for walking, the metro and buses. On arrival at 5pm, our suite wasn't ready - the receptionist promised that "presents" were being placed, so we accepted complimentary drinks in the lobby. However, apart from the fabulous selection of Hermes toiletries, we didn't find anything "present-like" (even water, which we should have had under the Privelidge card scheme). What we did find was a very decent sized room (Junior suite = bed plus sofa and chair, with separate loo!) with exceptional decor. We also found rubbish in the bathroom bin from the previous occupants - although housekeeping did remove it at our request...without apology. The infamous Sofitel "MyBed system" was a complete let down - whereas the same "system" in the Sofitel New York was as soft and comfortable as a cloud, at Le Faubourg was so hard it caused painful joints after 3 nights of (broken) sleep. This was in addition to the bin and recycling lorries arriving in Rue Boissy d'Anglas at 6.30am promptly and noisily EVERY MORNING and returning regularly until about 8.30am. Nothing like the sound of smashing wine bottles to jerk you awake in your very expensive hotel room. Do not ignore advice to request a room that does not overlook the street, even high floors, as the double glazing is truly inadequate!! The Buddha Bar is reputedly quite noisy at peak times (weekends, late evenings) although we never heard anything - but we wouldn't recommend eating there, as on the occasion that we did, we were treated to the sight of mice scurrying around on the floor. Breakfasts at Le Faubourg were great, but we've had very similar at the excellent (and inexpensive) Mercure Tour Eifffel for half the price. Service was either discreet or positively overpowering (dishes were whipped away before we had finished). One thing about this hotel is that you can remain quite isolated if you so desire - the elevators are controlled by key cards (great for security) and are next to the entrance, meaning you never have to make contact with any of the hotel staff (even the doorman, as the doors are automatic!). Frankly, for the price of the hotel, we expect a little more personal attention. Overall, we booked a Junior suite at a not-too-outrageous price, as it was August, and really enjoyed the good bits (location, a clean and sumptuous suite), but won't return because of the bad (NOISE, uncomfortable bed, lack of attention to the small details). One more thing - we filled in the comments card, but haven't had any contact from the hotel at all. I would have expected a truly premier hotel to respond with concern.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JERICHO61
Reviews.Content: I just returned form my stay in paris with my 16 yr old daughter. The hotel was in a great location with close proximity to the metro and the bus. The room itself was not as small asI have read in other reviews or I was just expecting a small room. The size was fine and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was very clean and modern and has all the amenities. We were on a non smoking floor which was perfect. It had rained quite a bit and the hotel had plenty of complimentay umbrella's. The breakfeast which was included in our hotel deal was just o.k. Typical breads, fruits and yogurt. I really liked they supplied water bottles in the room, it was a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only just OK”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegirl35
Reviews.Content: As far as location Sofitel Le Faubourg is excellent, as you are right in the centre of shopping and all the big ticket tourist attractions. However we found the rooms to very small,and badly designed. Beware!! do not take anything out of mini bar to make room for say a bottle of wine as the fridge has a sensor and we had a hard time trying to prove we had not consumed a 140Euro tab! We found the staff in the dining room to be surly and I dont think I ever saw a smile the whole time I was there. In terms of a decent business centre or gym- forget about it!! The breakfast was very average unless you like to eat cheese and cold meats and runny scrambled eggs. The fruit salad looks as though it is made on a weekly basis rather than daily.I have stayed a quite a few hotels in the Sofitel chain and I dont believe Le Faubourg is up to scratch in terms of staff and finer details. I feel there are much nicer places to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location”
Reviews.Author: leiceterboy
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely French hotel in the heart of Paris. The hotel is very well located for all the major sights of Paris. The rooms are relatively small but very well appointed and have everything you need for a comfortable stay. My only caveat is that the rooms towards the left hand end of the hotel as you face it on the street (room numbers ending 21) overlook the Buddha Bar and there is an outside terrace outside this bar that seems to go on into the small hours. The noise is not too intrusive but you can certainly hear people when they shout. It's not too bad a problem but if you really must have peace and quiet get an inward facing room

Reviews.Title: “The Right TWeouch”
Reviews.Author: HautMedoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this ausome hotel for our 10th year anniversary. We where welcomed with an upgrade and a bottle of Champaign. Melissa, in charge of guest relations could not have been nicer. The location is great for shopping, in the 8th district ,as well as a short walk to the left bank. The location is on a guarded block so the noise level is very quiet. The beds are so comfortable and breakfast is pleantiful. We had an excellent dinner at Dominic Brouchett, and a superb, special meal for our anniversary at Taillevent. Just be prepaired with your wallet. Paris is wonderful, altough the US$ dosen't go nearly as far as it used to, it is still it is a beautiful romantic city and Le Faubourg exceeded our expectations. I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: visitorxyz
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel experience in Paris. Great location, fantastically comfortable bed. Clean, quiet, bright. Located very close to the sights of Paris, near excellent shopping (cartier chanel viever all within 50 yards!) Cafe's nearby. I chose it based on positive reviews given on this site and wholeheartedly agree with them. No snooty too cool for school attitudes, just helpful efficient service and concierges (added a note to my email booking asking them to book a dinner table for me in town, which they did immediately) We were due to leave the hotel on the day of a big national holiday not realising the size of the crowds that would be in the area: the day before the hotel made a point of alerting us to that and arranging a taxi to be waiting for us in plenty of time for the trip to the airport. Room service was excellent. Highly recommended: Hotel Crillon location, considerably lower prices. My new favourite hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: woods1966
Reviews.Content: 4 star hotel. Location can't be beat. Service and staff were exemplary. I remain astonished at the extent to which smoking in public places, including the hotel lobby, pervades western europe, but then, I'm an American and have different expectations. So, other than a general lack of fresh air in the lobby, it was fantastic.
